title: Changes to COVID-19 vaccination strategy could speed up herd immunity
author: News Medical
description: "Unfortunately, until we can safely, rapidly, and affordably vaccinate enough people to achieve collective immunity, we cannot afford to disregard the benefits of naturally acquired immunity in those whose prior documented infections have already run their course," writes Martin Krsak [assistant professor of medicine at CU School of Medicine] and colleagues.
sitename: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
cleaned_text: Researchers in the United States have proposed changes to the current coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) vaccination strategy that they say would increase the likelihood of herd immunity being achieved in the most timely and cost-effective manner. CU Anschutz Fitzsimons Building
